snippet: Social media shopping sites are offering payments to shoppers who post product links that drive Web traffic and sales to retailers.
abstract: Social media shopping sites are offering payments to shoppers who post product links that drive Web traffic and sales to retailers, turning users' Twitter messages, Facebook posts, Pinterest images and e-mails into possible paid promotions; critics say that practice blurs the line between recommendations and paid endorsements, but marketers say shoppers are savvy enough to know the difference.
lead_paragraph: Social media shopping sites are offering payments to shoppers who post product links that drive Web traffic and sales to retailers.

headline.seo: Shopping Sites Pay Contributors Who Drive Traffic to Retailers
headline.main: Sites That Pay the Shopper for Being a Seller
